message.content: I want to build a discord bot that is a knowldege base for a team

I can see you want to build a Discord bot that serves as a knowledge base for a team. This is a great project idea! Let me structure this spec properly by parsing your initial description into organized fields and creating some initial idea cards for the key components.
the team isn't very big

payload.title: Team Knowledge Base Discord Bot
payload.one_liner: A Discord bot that serves as a centralized knowledge base for team collaboration and information retrieval.
payload.goal: Enable team members to easily store, search, and retrieve knowledge through a Discord bot interface.
payload.description: This project aims to create a Discord bot that functions as a knowledge base system for teams. Team members will be able to interact with the bot to save important information, documentation, FAQs, and other knowledge artifacts, and later retrieve them through search or queries. The bot will integrate seamlessly into the team's Discord workspace, making knowledge management accessible where the team already collaborates.

card.title: Knowledge Storage System
card.body: Implement a backend system to store knowledge entries with metadata like title, content, tags, author, and timestamp. Need to decide on database technology (e.g., SQLite, PostgreSQL, MongoDB).

card.title: Search and Retrieval Commands
card.body: Create Discord commands for searching the knowledge base. Users should be able to search by keywords, tags, or categories. Consider implementing fuzzy search for better user experience.

card.title: Add/Update/Delete Knowledge Entries
card.body: Implement commands for creating, updating, and deleting knowledge base entries. Should include proper permission checks to prevent unauthorized modifications.

card.title: User Authentication and Permissions
card.body: Design a permission system to control who can add, edit, or delete knowledge entries. Could be based on Discord roles or custom permission levels.

card.title: Category and Tag System
card.body: Implement a categorization system with tags and categories to organize knowledge entries. This will make it easier for users to browse and filter information.

message.content: I've structured your spec with a clear title, one-liner, goal, and description. I've also created 5 initial idea cards covering core features like storage, search, CRUD operations, permissions, and organization. Now I'd like to understand more about your specific needs.

question.question: What type of team will use this knowledge base, and what kind of information do you expect to store? For example: developer documentation, company procedures, troubleshooting guides, meeting notes, etc.?
question.placeholder: e.g., Software development team storing API docs and troubleshooting guides

payload.diff_summary: Initialized spec with title, one-liner, goal, and description. Created 5 idea cards for core features: knowledge storage system, search/retrieval, CRUD operations, authentication/permissions, and category/tag system. Asked user about team type and content to store.

message.content: Great! I can see the manager has created 5 solid foundational ideas. Now it's my turn to brainstorm additional creative ideas that would enhance this knowledge base bot, especially considering it's for a small team. I'll think about user experience features, automation possibilities, integration opportunities, and practical enhancements that would make this bot truly valuable for day-to-day use.

card.title: Quick Reference Commands
card.body: Implement shorthand commands like !kb or !know for quick access to the knowledge base. Could include autocomplete suggestions as users type, making it faster to find commonly accessed information without full searches.

card.title: Knowledge Entry Templates
card.body: Provide pre-defined templates for common entry types (e.g., 'Bug Fix', 'How-To Guide', 'FAQ', 'Meeting Summary'). This standardizes entries and makes it easier for team members to contribute without thinking about structure.

card.title: Suggested/Related Entries
card.body: When retrieving a knowledge entry, automatically suggest related entries based on tags or keywords. This helps users discover relevant information they might not have known to search for.

card.title: Bookmark/Favorites System
card.body: Allow users to bookmark frequently accessed knowledge entries for quick retrieval. Each user could have a personal favorites list accessible via a simple command like !kb favorites.

card.title: Version History and Rollback
card.body: Track changes to knowledge entries over time. Users can view edit history, see who made changes, and rollback to previous versions if needed. Important for maintaining accuracy and accountability.

card.title: Knowledge Usage Analytics
card.body: Track which entries are most frequently accessed, which are outdated (not accessed in X days), and which tags are most popular. Helps identify gaps in documentation and which information is most valuable.

card.title: Automatic Entry Expiration/Review
card.body: Set expiration dates or review reminders for knowledge entries to ensure information stays current. The bot could notify entry creators when content needs review, preventing outdated information from lingering.

card.title: File and Link Attachments
card.body: Allow knowledge entries to include file attachments (PDFs, images, documents) or external links. Store files in cloud storage or Discord attachments, making entries more comprehensive.

card.title: Inline Previews and Embeds
card.body: Display knowledge entries using Discord's rich embed format with proper formatting, syntax highlighting for code snippets, and collapsible sections for long entries. Makes information more readable.

card.title: Natural Language Queries
card.body: Implement AI/NLP capabilities to understand questions in natural language. Instead of exact keyword matching, users could ask 'How do I deploy to production?' and get relevant entries.

card.title: Simple Export/Import
card.body: Provide commands to export the entire knowledge base to JSON/CSV or import from existing documentation. Useful for backups, migrations, or seeding initial content from existing docs.

card.title: Random Knowledge Entry
card.body: Add a '!kb random' command that surfaces a random knowledge entry. Great for knowledge discovery, onboarding new members, or reminding the team about forgotten documentation.

card.title: Lightweight Onboarding Mode
card.body: Since it's a small team, create a special onboarding view that shows essential entries tagged as 'onboarding' or 'getting-started'. New members can quickly access critical information.

card.title: Reactions for Entry Quality
card.body: Let users react to knowledge entries with emojis (üëç/üëé) to indicate helpfulness. Popular entries could be featured, while low-rated ones could be flagged for improvement.

card.title: Direct Message Support
card.body: Allow users to query the knowledge base via DM with the bot, in addition to channel commands. Useful when someone doesn't want to clutter public channels with searches.

Perfect! I can see we have 20 idea cards with 2 already in the Spec lane (Knowledge Storage System and Search/Retrieval Commands), 1 in Plan (Category and Tag System), and 17 in Ideas. There's also a pending question about the team type and information they'll store.

My planning approach:
1. **Identify the MVP core features** - The absolute essentials needed for a functional knowledge base bot
2. **Move foundational cards to Plan** - Cards that represent critical infrastructure
3. **Create task cards** - Break down the core features into concrete, actionable development tasks
4. **Update spec core** - Add constraints and success criteria appropriate for a small team

Since this is for a small team, I'll prioritize simplicity and core functionality over complex features. The MVP should focus on:
- Core CRUD operations (create, read, update, delete knowledge entries)
- Basic search functionality
- Simple category/tag organization
- Basic permissions (to prevent accidental deletions)

Advanced features like NLP, analytics, and version history can be considered as enhancements after the MVP.

card.title: Set up Discord bot infrastructure
card.body: Initialize the Discord bot project with discord.py or discord.js. Set up bot token authentication, basic command handler structure, and deploy configuration. Include environment variable management for secrets.

card.title: Design and implement database schema
card.body: Create database schema for knowledge entries with fields: id, title, content/body, tags, category, author_id, created_at, updated_at. Choose appropriate database (SQLite for simplicity with small teams, or PostgreSQL for scalability).

card.title: Implement /kb-add command
card.body: Create Discord slash command to add new knowledge entries. Include parameters for title, content, tags, and category. Add validation and confirmation messages. Use Discord's modal/form interface for better UX.

card.title: Implement /kb-search command
card.body: Create search command that queries knowledge entries by keywords, tags, or categories. Display results in paginated embeds. Include fuzzy matching for better search experience.

card.title: Implement /kb-get command
card.body: Create command to retrieve a specific knowledge entry by ID or exact title match. Display full entry with rich formatting using Discord embeds, including syntax highlighting for code blocks.

card.title: Implement /kb-update and /kb-delete commands
card.body: Create commands for editing and deleting existing entries. Include permission checks (only author or admin roles can modify). Add confirmation dialogs for delete operations to prevent accidents.

card.title: Implement tagging and category system
card.body: Add support for multiple tags per entry and a single category. Create /kb-tags command to list all available tags. Implement /kb-categories to show category hierarchy. Allow filtering searches by tags and categories.

card.title: Add basic role-based permissions
card.body: Implement permission checks based on Discord roles. Define who can create/read/update/delete entries. Consider: everyone can read, members can create, authors and admins can update/delete their own entries.

card.title: Create /kb-list command
card.body: Implement command to list all knowledge entries with pagination. Include sorting options (by date, by title, by popularity). Display compact summaries with option to view full entry.

card.title: Small team simplicity
card.body: The bot must be simple to use and maintain for a small team. Avoid over-engineering. Prioritize intuitive commands and clear feedback over complex features.

card.title: Discord platform limitations
card.body: Must work within Discord's API rate limits, message length limits (2000 chars), and embed size restrictions. Long entries should be paginated or truncated with links to full content.

payload.constraints:
1. Must be simple and intuitive for small team usage
2. Work within Discord API limitations (rate limits, message length, embed sizes)
3. Minimize hosting/infrastructure costs for small team deployment
4. Prioritize core functionality over advanced features for MVP
payload.success_criteria:
1. Team members can add knowledge entries via simple Discord commands
2. Entries are searchable by keywords, tags, and categories
3. Search results are returned within 2 seconds
4. Entries display properly formatted in Discord embeds
5. Only authorized users can modify or delete entries
6. Bot remains responsive with up to 1000 knowledge entries
7. New team members can learn the basic commands within 5 minutes
payload.notes: Focus on MVP first: core CRUD operations, basic search, and simple organization. Advanced features like NLP queries, analytics, and version history can be phase 2 enhancements after validating the core concept with the team.

card.title: Tech Stack Decision: discord.js + TypeScript
card.body:
**Decision Made**: JavaScript/TypeScript with discord.js library

**Rationale**: Popular choice with excellent ecosystem, strong community support, and comprehensive documentation. TypeScript provides type safety for larger codebases.

**Implications**:
- Use Node.js runtime
- Database options: SQLite (better-sqlite3), PostgreSQL (pg), or MongoDB (mongoose)
- Deploy on Node-friendly platforms (Heroku, Railway, DigitalOcean, AWS Lambda)
- Package manager: npm or yarn
- Consider TypeScript for better maintainability

payload.body: Initialize the Discord bot project using discord.js with TypeScript. Set up bot token authentication via environment variables (.env file), implement basic slash command handler structure using Discord's interaction API, and configure deployment settings. Include package.json with necessary dependencies (discord.js, dotenv, typescript, ts-node).

Create database schema for knowledge entries with fields: id, title, content/body, tags (array), category, author_id (Discord user ID), created_at, updated_at. Choose database based on scale: SQLite with better-sqlite3 for simplicity (recommended for small teams), or PostgreSQL with pg library for scalability. Create migration scripts and ORM setup.

Create Discord slash command (/kb-add) to add new knowledge entries. Use Discord.js CommandBuilder to define parameters for title (string, required), content (string, required), tags (string, optional, comma-separated), and category (string, optional with autocomplete). Implement using Discord Modal for multi-line content input. Add validation and send confirmation embed with entry ID.

Create /kb-search slash command that queries knowledge entries by keywords, tags, or categories using SQL LIKE or full-text search. Display results in paginated embeds using Discord.js button components for navigation. Include fuzzy matching with string similarity algorithms (fuse.js library). Limit results to 10 per page.

Create /kb-get command to retrieve a specific knowledge entry by ID or exact title match. Display full entry using Discord.js EmbedBuilder with rich formatting. Include syntax highlighting for code blocks using discord.js codeblock formatting. Add metadata footer (author, created date, last updated, view count).

Create /kb-update and /kb-delete slash commands for editing and deleting entries. Use Discord.js permission checks to ensure only entry author or users with admin/moderator roles can modify. Implement Discord Modal for edit interface. Add confirmation buttons for delete operations using Discord.js ActionRowBuilder to prevent accidents.

Add support for multiple tags per entry (stored as array in database) and a single category per entry. Create /kb-tags command to list all available tags with usage counts. Implement /kb-categories to show category list. Add autocomplete functionality for tags and categories in add/update commands using Discord.js autocomplete interactions.

Implement permission checks using Discord.js GuildMember.roles and Permissions API. Define access control: everyone can read and search, authenticated server members can create entries, entry authors and users with ADMINISTRATOR or MANAGE_MESSAGES permissions can update/delete. Store permission config in environment variables for flexibility.

Implement /kb-list command to display all knowledge entries with pagination using Discord.js button-based navigation. Include sorting options (by date, by title, by popularity/views) using slash command options. Display compact summaries (title, category, first 100 chars, entry ID) with buttons to view full entry. Use EmbedBuilder for clean presentation.

card.title: Set up TypeScript configuration and build process
card.body: Configure TypeScript for the project with tsconfig.json (target: ES2020, module: commonjs, strict mode enabled). Set up build scripts in package.json for development (ts-node-dev for hot reload) and production (tsc compilation). Configure ESLint and Prettier for code quality. Add npm scripts for start, dev, build, and lint.
